page.title: 02Tiverton 1085-1985 Then/Now
page.content: Life in our D Block is very different from William I's day. Farming is still dominant in how the land is used but far fewer people take part in agriculture. We easily forget how much we depend on our farmers, even in a country area like Tiverton. Fashion and trends are different. People now wear clothes which they think will make them look attractive. In the past the main concern was more practical - to keep warm. Transport is very different too. The countryside is crossed by hundreds of tarmac-covered roads and most families have a car or use public transport. The general public is now catered for in a better way (eg schools, shops, hospitals). People now can hold their own ideas about politics and religion. We are glad to be alive today!
